intro: Centaurea bella, commonly known as the beautiful cornflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower heads, which are surrounded by bright yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. Centaurea bella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and meadows.
